content: little mosaic squares overlay mosaic crochet centre-out tutorial universal terms are used throughout to keep the written instructions as short as possible i have simplified the abbreviations to make them universal and remove the need for separate uk and us versions summary of main universal abbreviations b bldc uk blsc us f fltr2d uk fldc2d us c corner st bldc uk blsc us f corner st fltr2d uk fldc2d us fo fasten_off video tutorials are available from my youtube channel right-handed https //youtu be/5dnmxjrzftu left-handed https //youtu be/f5fbiahg7ro for full list of abbreviations and detailed instructions for stitches see last 2 pages 1 © rosina plane www rosinaplane com before i begin i would like to acknowledge the fantastic work of my lovely testers listed below who have given up their time at very short notice to help me produce this little tutorial for you linda croshaw zahra fazel jane reid materials used you can use any yarn you wish just make sure both colours are roughly the same weight and you use a hook appropriate for the yarn i used stylecraft special dk 100% acrylic 295m per 100g ball and a 4mm hook approximately 4g / 12m of c1 and 3 5g / 10m of c2 per square gauge / gauge completed square measures just under 10 x 10 cm using stylecraft special dk and a 4mm hook note gauge is not important for this tutorial and the finished size will vary depending on the yarn and hook you are using pattern notes this design uses the overlay mosaic crochet technique so there are no colour changes within rounds all rounds are worked with the right side facing you full written instructions are given and i have also provided a chart for one side of the square which should be repeated a total of 4 times on each round the pattern is written for two colours c1 is the lighter colour in my sample c2 is the darker colour you can of course switch these around if you wish see the green / cream sample on page 1 … and it will also look pretty in a single colour or with less contrast making it ideal for a temperature blanket stitch counts at the end of each round i will show a stitch count in italics this count does not include corner chains 2 © rosina plane www rosinaplane com top tips and chart notes there are no colour changes within rounds unless otherwise stated do not cut yarn at the end of each round leave unused colour on ws and simply pull up a loop in the new colour between the joining slip_stitch orange marker and the turning chain at the start of the new round green marker you may find it useful to place a marker in the joining slip_stitch as that is where you will be working your final stitch of the next round for rounds with 2f on either side of the corner chain these
